references.paper_title: Neural mechanisms for the recognition of biological movements
references.reason: This paper is foundational for understanding the neural processes behind biological motion perception, providing a theoretical basis for the current work.

references.paper_title: Visual perception of biological motion and a model for its analysis
references.reason: This seminal work introduced the point-light walker paradigm, which is central to the study of biological motion and forms the basis of the experimental design in this paper.

references.paper_title: Quo vadis, action recognition? a new model and the kinetics dataset
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduced the Kinetics dataset, a large-scale benchmark for video action recognition used for comparison in the current work.

references.paper_title: Emerging properties in self-supervised vision transformers
references.reason: This paper describes DINO, a self-supervised vision transformer model, which provides the backbone feature extractor for the MP model.

references.paper_title: An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale
references.reason: This paper introduced the Vision Transformer (ViT) architecture which is foundational to many modern computer vision models, and is relevant to the MP model’s architecture.
